description: {"blocks":[{"key":"ctnqi","text":"We developed a single-nucleus multiomic sequencing technology (snm3C-seq3) to assay both the methylome and chromatin contacts from within the same cell.  We further adapted this protocol to allow for mass-scale assessment, assaying thousands of cells at a time.  This protocol is an expanded and updated version of snmC-seq2, adding in the chromatin contact assay and optimizing the pooling strategy of mass-scale library preps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":261}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":"We developed a single-nucleus multiomic sequencing technology (snm3C-seq3) to assay both the methylome and chromatin conformation from within the same cell.  We further adapted this protocol to allow for mass-scale assessment, assaying thousands of cells at a time."}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"17kev","text":"
Primer Information

Part 1: Primer structure

Random primer:
/5SpC3/TTCCCTACACGACGCTCTTCCGATCTXXXXXXXX(H1:33340033)(H1)(H1)(H1)(H1)(H1)(H1)(H1)(H1)
Where the XXXXXXXX is an 8-bp barcode sequence, see the barcode sequence and name below.

PCR i5 primer: 
AATGATACGGCGACCACCGAGATCTACACXXXXXXXXXXACACTCTTTCCCTACACGACGCTCT
Where the XXXXXXXXXX is a 10-bp barcode sequence, see the barcode sequence and name below. The i5 and i7 primers are in pairs.

PCR i7 primer:
CAAGCAGAAGACGGCATACGAGATXXXXXXXXXXGTGACTGGAGTTCAGACGTGTGCTCTT
Where the XXXXXXXXXX is a 10-bp barcode sequence, see the barcode sequence and name below. The i5 and i7 primers are in pairs.

 Primer names and sequences can be found in the attached document:

NIM: Sucrose (250 mM), KCl (25 mM), MgCl2 (5 mM), Tris-Cl pH 8.0 (10 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0lrv","text":"        2. {"blocks":[{"key":"bmm60","text":"Prepare the following solutions fresh before each experiment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63geo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"99bqi","text":"1. NIMT (on ice): NIM + Triton X-100 (0.1%) + DTT (1 mM) + Proteinase Inhibitor (1:100 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sho6","text":"            dilution)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9utj","text":"2. 50% Iodixanol (Room temp) : 5 vol. Optiprep (60% Iodixanol) + 1 vol Dilutent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23bms","text":"3. 25% Iodixanol (Room temp) : 1 vol. 50% Iodixanol + 1 vol NIM","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cso22","text":"4. DPBS + 1% BSA (on ice) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fo39q","text":"Prepare nuclei:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cip2v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3r3nn","text":"1. Fast cool centrifuge with swinging bucket tube rotor to 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v8uv","text":"2. Remove frozen tissue from -80°C freezer, place on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ese6","text":"3. Transfer tissue with 2.4 mL NIMT from tube into the large dounce.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hdd4","text":"4. Use loose pestle A 40 times gently without introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5j073","text":"5. Use tight pestle B 40 times gently without introducing bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"901bv","text":"6. Transfer lysed solution into a 5-mL or 15-mL tube and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edcv0","text":"7.  If doing NeuN stain: Add 6 μL of NeuN 488 (1:500 dil).  Mix and incubate 15 min on ice, keeping solution covered from light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn9jt","text":"8. Mix the lysis suspension with 1.5 mL of 50% Iodixanol by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78ddk","text":"9. Slowly pipette 1 mL of cell mixture onto 500 μL 25% Iodixanol cushion, 4 x 2-mL tubes in total per sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epp2c","text":"10. Centrifuge in swing rotor for 20 min at 10,000 x g at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ilea","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c00e","text":"Crosslinking:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40emg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap4ho","text":"1. Split sample into 2 tubes (1-2 million nuclei in each tube) and bring volume up to 1 mL with DPBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csr1p","text":"2. Add 57 µL of 37% formaldehyde (for a final concentration of 2%) to each tube and mix well by inverting 10 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3njk","text":"3. Incubate 10 min (5 min if a NeuN pre-stain was done to avoid stain degradation) at room temperature, inverting occasionally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g3g7","text":"4. Add 91.9 µL Stop Solution (or 2.5 M Glycine) and mix well by inverting 10 times.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejakd","text":"5. Incubate for 5 min at room temperature, inverting occasionally.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nbre","text":"6. Place sample on ice and incubate an additional 5 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6e8bv","text":"7. Pellet cells by centrifuging 5 min at 2500 x g or 10 min at 1000 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68rl1","text":"8. Discard supernatant, being sure to leave no residual liquid, and resuspend in 1 mL of 1x PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egdiv","text":"9. Repeat steps 7-8 two more times to completely wash away residual formaldehyde/glycine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8mmg4","text":"10. Proceed directly to next section or freeze samples at -80°C up to 5 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Add 24 µL Conditioning Solution and mix gently by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"n4ou","text":"3. Incubate at 62°C for 10 min. Add 20 µL Stop Solution 2 and mix gently by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bich2","text":"5. Incubate at 37°C for 15 min.  If using a thermal cycler, set the lid temperature to 85°C.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Centrifuge at 1,000 x g for 10 min at 4°C in swinging bucket rotor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcvse","text":"3. Remove supernatant and gently resuspend in 200 µL DPBS + 1% BSA.  Add another 800 µL DPBS + 1% BSA to bring total volume up to 1 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2b139","text":"4. Use 2N gating for Hoechst stain to exclude debris and nuclei in cell replication stages.  See example gate with Hoechst on the x-axis and side scatter on the y-axis. If NeuN 488 stained: Sort NeuN+ in col 1-22 and NeuN- in col 23-24","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a1af7","text":"        c. Add 6 µL CT Conversion Reagent to each well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ssbe","text":"2. Seal, vortex, and quick spin (500 rcf) plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu2tb","text":"3. Incubate plates using [DIRECT] method on PCR machines with 384-well plate block.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7b0m3","text":"        a. 98 °C for 8 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6h92","text":"        b. 64 °C for 3.5 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btk8q","text":"        c. Hold at 4 °C for up to 20 hours","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f145n","text":"Bisulfite Cleanup:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6l5gd","text":"*Steps in this section are automated for up to 8 x 384-well plates using Biomek i7\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p67f","text":"Prepare MagBead master plate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8j3b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab4si","text":"a. Invert Magbead J stock tube repeatedly to ensure homogeneity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epegv","text":"b. Using an 8-channel pipette, aliquot 58 μL Magbead J stock to each well of a 96-well plate (avoid bubbles and do not spin). Tap plate to remove bubbles.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"567da","text":"c. Distribute 14 μL beads to each well of a clean 384-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jq41","text":"d. Tap down 384-well plate and pipette out any bubbles from the bottom of the wells (do not spin).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62inm","text":"e. Distribute 1.5 μL to each well of sample plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56mmu","text":"Bind the free DNA to the Magbeads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d1e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h2mu","text":"a. Add 20 µL M-Binding Buffer to each well and mix by pipetting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n718","text":"b. Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"96iob","text":"c. Move the plates onto the magnets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dh6pk","text":"d. Remove supernatant and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdgcg","text":"Wash the beads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jgd0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bf9ii","text":"a. With the plates still on the magnets, add 20 μL M-Wash Buffer to all plates and incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fid8h","text":"b. Remove supernatant and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7ria6","text":"Add M-Desulphonation Buffer to the plates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6m8ql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp4r1","text":"a. Add 15 μL M-Desulphonation Buffer to all plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6fgo","text":"b. Incubate at room temperature for 15 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2347a","text":"c. Remove supernatant and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3tr5l","text":"Wash the beads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo358","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27vep","text":"a. Add 20 μL M-Wash Buffer to all plates and incubate at room temperature for 30 seconds.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9054k","text":"b. Remove supernatant and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"but1e","text":"c. Repeat wash one additional time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3rl27","text":"(Optional) Do an extra supernatant removal to further empty out wells if desired","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"deoi7","text":"Let the plates dry:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4mor","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20u95","text":"a. Let plates sit for 5 minutes.  Keep them on the magnets to avoid beads jumping due to static.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4o1ko","text":"b. Check that all the wash buffer has evaporated before moving on.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14ql4","text":"Elute the DNA from the beads using the RP elution plate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47p8k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bqevd","text":"a. Add 5.5 μL appropriate Random Primer solution to all plates (note the barcodes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4afpp","text":"b. Remove the plates from the magnets and seal well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2q5bp","text":"c. DO NOT VORTEX; instead, throw the sealed plates onto the bench 10-15 times, until beads appear to be mixed into elution buffer. Repeat for all plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai2s5","text":"d. Quick spin plates for 5s at 200xg","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jktd","text":"e. Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.  Place plates back onto the magnets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5t871","text":"Transfer eluted DNA into clean 384-well plates:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"87p1b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bh2t4","text":"a. Transfer 5 µL sample elution into a clean, labeled 384-well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2n0","text":"b. Seal new sample plates and quick spin for 5s at 500xg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"af0st","text":"(Optional) If running 16 plates, repeat steps 12:1-12:9 for the second set of 8 plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eh9s1","text":"Random primed DNA synthesis:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mjva","text":"**Steps in this section are automated for up to 16 x 384-well plates using Biomek i7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hnr3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7cu6s","text":"1. Prepare appropriate volume of Random Priming Master Mix (RP MM) in a 50-mL conical tube and invert to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nagu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fan0b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4977s","text":"2. Denature 8 sample plates at 98 °C for 3 minutes in thermocycler. Remove plates from PCR machines and immediately place on ice to prevent rehybridization. Proceed once bottom of each plate is cool to the touch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8sfnq","text":"3. Add 5 μL RP MM to each sample well.  Seal, vortex, and quick spin (5s at 500xg) sample plates.\n4. Repeat steps 2-4 for second set of 8 plates (if applicable).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["208.00000762939453","116.00000762939453","115.00000762939453","119.00000762939453"],"data":[["Reagent","Volume per rxn","Vol for 8 plates","Vol for 16 plates"],["Nuclease-free H2O","3.45 µL","12420 µL","24840 µL"],["Enzymatics Blue Buffer (10x)","1.025 µL","3690 µL","7380 µL"],["dNTPs (10 mM each)","0.50 µL","1800 µL","3600 µL"],["Klenow Exo- (50 U/µL)","0.025 µL","90 µL","180 µL"]],"guid":"C5AF59E548A34B01967A12EDB4D1E33D","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Volume per rxn","Vol for 8 plates","Vol for 16 plates"],["Nuclease-free H2O","3.45 µL","12420 µL","24840 µL"],["Enzymatics Blue Buffer (10x)","1.025 µL","3690 µL","7380 µL"],["dNTPs (10 mM each)","0.50 µL","1800 µL","3600 µL"],["Klenow Exo- (50 U/µL)","0.025 µL","90 µL","180 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

Prepare appropriate volume of Exo/rSAP Master Mix (E/S MM) in a 15-mL
conical tube and invert to mix.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d0ev3","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"frk02","text":"2. Add 1.5 μL Exo/Sap Master Mix to each sample well. Seal, vortex, and quick spin sample plates (5s at 500xg).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vh78","text":"3. Incubate plates in thermocycler with the following program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rcdj","text":"        a. 37°C for 30 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c53eb","text":"        b. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57cnq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["179.00000762939453",100,"116.00000762939453","126.00000762939453"],"data":[["Reagent","Vol per rxn","Vol per 8 plates","Vol per 16 plates"],["Nuclease-free H2O","1.15 µL","4140 µL","8280 µL"],["Enzymatics Blue Buffer (10x)","0.2 µL","720 µL","1480 µL"],["Exonuclease I (20 U/µL)","0.1 µL","360 µL","720 µL"],["rSAP (1 U/µL)","0.05 µL","180 µL","360 µL"]],"guid":"7FF05D372C654334BB95CFBD97B53621","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Vol per rxn","Vol per 8 plates","Vol per 16 plates"],["Nuclease-free H2O","1.15 µL","4140 µL","8280 µL"],["Enzymatics Blue Buffer (10x)","0.2 µL","720 µL","1480 µL"],["Exonuclease I (20 U/µL)","0.1 µL","360 µL","720 µL"],["rSAP (1 U/µL)","0.05 µL","180 µL","360 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"632nm","text":"Compress 16 x 384-well plates to 8 x 96-well plates and add SeraMagbeads\n**Steps in this section are automated for 16 x 384-well plates using Biomek i7.  Note that the bead cleanups for each set of plates will overlap to increase timing efficiency.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eesoo","text":"Thaw (if applicable) and quick spin (5s at 500xg) sample plates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6lsna","text":"Compress 384-well plates 1-8 into four new 96-well plates 1-4.  8 wells will be combined into one well.  One 384-well plate will be compressed to half a 96-well plate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7878","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aq1qa","text":"a. Combine samples from each quadrant of the top half of 384-plate 1 (Rows A-H) and
dispense into the top half of a clean 96-well plate (Rows A-D).
        Eg: A1,A2,B1,B2 of 384-well plate combine into A1 of the 96-well plate.
              A3,A4,B3,B4 of 384-well plate combine into A2 of the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btvqm","text":"b. Combine samples from each quadrant of the bottom half of 384-plate 1 (Rows I-P) and dispense into top half of the same 96-well plate (Rows A-D).
        Eg: I1,I2,J1,J2 of 384-well plate combine into A1 of the 96-well plate along with the A/B row ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh46b","text":"              samples.
c. Continue this pattern of pooling with 384-well plate 2 going into the bottom half of the same 96-well plate. Plates 3-4 will go into a second 96-well plate, 5-6 into a third 96-well plate, and Plates 7-8 into a fourth 96-well plate.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9cqsp","text":"Bind the free DNA to the Sera-Mag beads in 96-well plates 1-4:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7df5k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f5l1o","text":"a. Thoroughly mix Sera-Mag beads by repeatedly inverting bottle and pour Sera-Mag beads to the brim of a low-profile 96-well reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5auhd","text":"b. Add 73.6 μL beads into sample plates and pipette up and down to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2s2k5","text":"c. Let plates incubate at room temperature for at least 5 minutes.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aj172","text":"Compress 384-well plates 9-16 into four new 96-well plates 5-8:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pb7u","text":"\na. Combine 384-well plates 9-16 following the same pattern of pooling in Step 15.2 above.  Plates 9-10 will go into a fifth 96-well plate, 11-12 into a sixth 96-well plate, Plates 13-14 into a seventh 96-well plate, and Plates 15-16 into a eighth 96-well plate.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4aj8n","text":"Bind the free DNA to the Sera-Mag beads in 96-well plates 5-8:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20cln","text":"\na. Thoroughly mix Sera-Mag beads by repeatedly inverting bottle and pour Sera-Mag beads to the brim of a low-profile 96-well reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aau5u","text":"b. Place plates 1-4 onto 96-well magnet and incubate for at least 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu59a","text":"c. Add 73.6 μL beads to sample plates 5-8 and pipette up and down to mix.  Incubate for at least 5 minutes.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7kfjc","text":"Perform bead cleanups on 96-well plates 1-8","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdv43","text":"Carefully remove supernatant from plates 1-4 and discard in waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"evo15","text":"Wash beads in plates 1-4 with 80% EtOH:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"332r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm50","text":"a. Keeping plates on the magnets, add 180μL of 80% EtOH to plates 1-4 and incubate at room temperature for at least 30 seconds. Subsequently remove and discard EtOH in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"470b4","text":"b. Repeat for a second wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4uag2","text":"c. Remove plates from the magnets and incubate until beads are dry.  The beads should appear cracked and there should be no visible droplets of EtOH in the wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ft8n5","text":"Remove supernatant and add EtOH to 96 plates 5-8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mvv5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbk0n","text":"a. Carefully remove supernatant from plates 5-8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fct21","text":"b. Add 180 μL EtOH to plates 5-8 and incubate for at least 30 seconds.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ueki","text":"Elute DNA from plates 1-4 and perform second EtOH wash on plates 5-8:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vk5n","text":"\na. Once beads are dry, add 10 μL EB to plates 1-4. Set a 5-minute timer upon completion of transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enk7r","text":"b. Seal plates, vortex until beads no longer remain on the sides of the well, and quick spin 5s @ 150xg to avoid pelleting beads. When 5-minute timer is completed, replace plates on the magnets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ld8g","text":"c. Remove EtOH from plates 5-8 and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45m76","text":"d. Repeat EtOH wash of plates 5-8.\ne. Remove plates from the magnets and incubate until beads are dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rs7a","text":"Elute DNA from plates 5-8:\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3a9i","text":"a. Once plates are dry, add 10 μL EB to plates 5-8. Start a 5-minute timer upon completion of transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2o1on","text":"b. Seal plates, vortex until beads no longer remain on the sides of the well, and quick spin 5s @ 150xg to avoid pelleting beads.  When 5-minute timer is completed, replace plates on the magnets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"aojjm","text":"Compress 8 x 96-well plates to 1 x 96-well plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmup8","text":"Further compress plates 1-4 into a clean 96-well plate (Rows A-D).  4 wells will combine into 1 well of the new plate.  Each original 384-well plate will be contained in one row of the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6r5qq","text":"
a. Carefully unseal plates 1-4, still on the magnets.
b. Transfer eluted sample from plates 1-4 into a new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1vhs","text":"c. Combine rows A-D of plate 1 into row A of the new plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ua0j","text":"d. Combine rows E-H of plate 1 into row B of the new plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjikl","text":"e. Continue this pattern with A-D of plate 2 in row C of the new plate, etc, until rows E-H of plate 4 are in row H of the new plate.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d7ln6","text":"Further compress 96-well plates 5-8 into new 96-well plate.  8 wells will combine into 1 well of the new plate.  Each original 384-well plate will be contained in one row of the 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uuem","text":"\na. Transfer eluted sample from plates 5-8 into a new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"939tu","text":"b. Combine rows A-D of plate 5 into row A of the new plate","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3sjj","text":"c. Combine rows E-H of plate 5 into row B of the new plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp6cb","text":"d. Continue this pattern with A-D of plate 6 in row C of the new plate, etc, until rows E-H of plate 8 are in row H of the new plate.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7g3m2","text":"Compress the two 96-well plates into single new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mfj2","text":"
a. Transfer Columns 1-6 of first 96-well plate into Columns 1-6 of a new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52kvg","text":"b. Transfer Columns 7-12 of first 96-well plate into Columns 1-6 of the new 96-well plate
to combine with previous transfer.
c. Transfer Columns 1-6 of second 96-well plate into Columns 7-12 of the new 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qs3p","text":"d. Transfer Columns 7-12 of second 96-well plate into Columns 7-12 of the new 96-well plate to combine with previous transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqujt","text":"Note: final plate configuration will have six wells per original 384-well plate
i.e., wells A1-A6 contain plate 1, wells B1-B6 contain plate 2, etc. for the
rest of the left half of the plate. Wells A7-A12 contain plate 9, wells B7-B12
contain plate 10, etc. for the rest of the right half of the plate.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":303}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6053d","text":"Perform bead cleanup on compressed 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fjfug","text":"Bind free DNA to the Sera-Mag beads:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ghac","text":"\na. Thoroughly mix Sera-Mag beads by repeatedly inverting bottle and pour beads to the brim of the bead reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bove7","text":"b. Add 64 μL beads to each well of the sample plate and pipette up and down to mix.  Incubate\nat room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tuqc","text":"c. Move plate to plate magnet and wait until beads are settled to continue (approximately 3 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15obh","text":"d. Carefully remove supernatant and discard in waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8m14l","text":"Wash beads with 80% EtOH:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1usga","text":"\na. Keeping plates on the magnets, add 180μL of 80% EtOH to plates 1-4 and incubate at room temperature for at least 30 seconds. Subsequently remove and discard EtOH in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2eh25","text":"b. Repeat for a second wash.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4h1lq","text":"c. Remove plates from the magnets and incubate until beads are dry.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1dh3g","text":"Elute DNA","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7os0","text":"
a. Add 10 μL EB to each well of the sampleplate.  Set a 5-minute timer. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5lmq6","text":"b. Seal plate, vortex until beads no longer cling to sides of wells, then quick spin
for 5s at 100xg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cot62","text":"c. After 5-minute timer is complete, unseal plate and place on magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cntou","text":"d. Once beads have settled on the magnet (about 30 seconds), transfer elution to a
clean 96-well plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rdnk","text":"e. Check plate to ensure volume of wells appear even. Seal and quick spin (500xg).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tnl0","text":"Adaptase addition","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4d74c","text":"*Steps in this section are automated for 8 or 16 original 384-well plates using Biomek i7","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlkf6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bl6q","text":"1. Prepare appropriate volume of Adaptase Mix in a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube and keep on ice.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqo56","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2kifj","text":"2. Denature the 96-well plate in a thermocycler at 98 °C for 3 minutes.  Immediately place on ice
to prevent rehybridization. Plate is ready once bottom of plate is cool to the touch.  Quick spin plate 5s at 500xg before unsealing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26jh5","text":"3. Transfer 10.5 μL Adaptase mix to sample plate.  Seal, vortex, and quick spin (5s at 500xg).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cqrqo","text":"4. Incubate plate in a thermocycler with the following program:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"q3e2","text":"        a. 37°C for 30 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o87h","text":"        b. 95°C for 2 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"catbk","text":"        c. Hold at 4 °C
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100],"data":[["Reagent","Vol per rxn","Vol per 8 plates","Vol per 16 plates"],["Elution Buffer (EB)","4.45 µL","239.2 µL","478.4 µL"],["Buffer G1","2.00 µL","112.5 µL","225.0 µL"],["Reagent G2","2.00 µL","112.5 µL","225.0 µL"],["Reagent G3","1.25 µL","70.3 µL","140.6 µL"],["Enzyme G4","0.50 µL","28.13 µL","56.26 µL"],["Enzyme G5","0.50 µL","28.13 µL","56.26 µL"]],"guid":"1C8412351DB94F6C81E593F2E2A0EB83","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Reagent","Vol per rxn","Vol per 8 plates","Vol per 16 plates"],["Elution Buffer (EB)","4.45 µL","239.2 µL","478.4 µL"],["Buffer G1","2.00 µL","112.5 µL","225.0 µL"],["Reagent G2","2.00 µL","112.5 µL","225.0 µL"],["Reagent G3","1.25 µL","70.3 µL","140.6 µL"],["Enzyme G4","0.50 µL","28.13 µL","56.26 µL"],["Enzyme G5","0.50 µL","28.13 µL","56.26 µL"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fq258","text":"PCR Reaction:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92vkj","text":"\n1. Add 5 μL PCR primers to sample plate.  Be sure each set of 6 wells (the original 384-well plate) gets a uniquely indexed primer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7biis","text":"2. Transfer 25 μL KAPA to each well.  Seal, vortex, and quick spin (5s at 500xg).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sfvt","text":"3. Incubate plate in a thermocycler using the following method:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7rhtf","text":"        a. 95°C for 2 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"am3sf","text":"        b. 98°C for 30 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1pum","text":"        c. 98°C for 15 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fur8","text":"        d. 64°C for 30 seconds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ec0ei","text":"        e. 72°C for 2 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a79c5","text":"        f. Repeat steps c through e for a total of 13 cycles","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lho3","text":"        g. 72°C for 5 minutes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clj9j","text":"        h. Hold at 4°C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94kvs","text":"  **Note: 13 cycles is sufficient for mouse/human samples.  More cycles should be run for smaller ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e0mjo","text":"      genomes (eg. Arabidopsis)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ftblm","text":"4. Plate can be held at 4°C overnight or stored at -20°C for longer times\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9nr22","text":"Perform bead cleanup on PCR plate:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34cn8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r8sm","text":"1. Thoroughly mix Sera-Mag beads by repeatedly inverting bottle and pour beads to the brim of the bead reservoir.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ss4n","text":"2. Add 40 μL beads to the sample plate and mix by pipetting.  Upon addition of beads, start\na 5-minute timer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn3jm","text":"3. When 5-minute timer is complete, move plate onto magnet.  Wait until the beads are settled to continue (approximately 3 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"p0fl","text":"4. Carefully remove supernatant and discard in the waste trough.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfs7l","text":"5. Perform two 180 μL EtOH washes on plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa4pk","text":"6. After second EtOH wash is complete, remove plate from the magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68p9g","text":"7. Once beads are dry, add 20 μL EB to each well of the plate. Start a 5-minute timer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt1nf","text":"8. Seal plate, vortex until beads no longer cling to sides of wells, and quick spin for 5s at 100xg.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dk0mj","text":"9. After 5-minute timer is complete, place plate onto magnet and carefully unseal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cmdoa","text":"Perform bead cleanup on compressed samples in tubes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7k6h6","text":"
1. Using a 200 μL 8-channel pipette, compress wells such that samples from each
original 384-well plate are contained in a single well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgiup","text":"        a. Sample from A1-A6 should end up in A6, sample from B1-B6 should end up in B6, etc.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"328ch","text":"2. Using a P-200 pipette, transfer sample from each well into an individually labeled, 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube (16 tubes for 16 original 384-well plates).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ofsg","text":"3. Add 96 μL Sera-Mag beads to each microcentrifuge tube. Set a 5-minute timer, then vortex and quick spin all tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvsve","text":"4. After the 5-minute timer has completed, place each tube onto the DynaMag tube magnet. Allow beads to settle (approximately 3 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f4ui","text":"5. Remove and discard supernatant, careful to not disturb the beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csl94","text":"6. Wash beads with 300 μL EtOH.  Remove and discard EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1jpcl","text":"7. Repeat step 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d734","text":"8. Using a P-10 pipette, remove any residual EtOH at the bottom of the tube and discard.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gle8","text":"9. Remove tubes from DynaMag tube magnet and allow to dry with lid open until beads are visibly cracked and there are no visible droplets of EtOH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76g2n","text":"10. Add 20 μL EB to each tube. Set a 5-minute timer, then vortex and quick spin all tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmnsg","text":"11. After 5-minute timer has completed, place each tube onto the DynaMag tube magnet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uinh","text":"12. Transfer 20 μL from each sample tube into a new clean, labeled, 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube.  Try not to transfer any beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dhh4","text":"*TIP: It helps to not push the tubes all the way down on the magnet.  Slide them in about halfway so the bead pellet stays near the liquid.
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":139}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5emf","text":"DNA Quantification and sample pooling:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nd3a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bmum5","text":"1. To quantify the DNA in each sample tube, prepare an appropriate volume of Qubit reagent in a 15 mL microcentrifuge tube according to manufacturer’s instructions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f77e","text":"        a. Label one Qubit assay tube per sample.  Label two additional tubes for the standards ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qptj","text":"            included in the Qubit kit.  Also label tubes for any pools to be made.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u5dg","text":"        b. Combine Qubit reagent and DNA in Qubit assay tubes according to manufacturer’s ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31o5j","text":"            specifications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drnr4","text":"2. Measure the concentrations using the Qubit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bje4k","text":"3. Create sequencing pool by combining normalized amounts of each sample tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcmgn","text":"4. Check the concentration of the pool using the Qubit. Pool is now ready for sequencing.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
